creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: "...long, large scroll in colors on silk, showing in detailed pictorial format the Tokaido Route [Road] and its human background. . . . The names of various stages and famous sights of the Tokaido are written in gold directly on the silk--from the daimyo procession leaving Edo, the pleasure-boats and teahouses of Shinagawa, the villagers of Kawasaki, the fishermen and teashop girls of Fujisawa, the boatmen, Hanamizu Brodge, Oiso, the Sakawa River-crossing, the Castle of Odawara, the Haya River and Yunomoto Hotsprings... Hakone with its lake and barrier-station, Yamanaka and Mishima, with its temple and gardens and the Senkan Bridge, the rustic bridge and Village of Mumazu.... Apparently, a description written by Richard Lane (complete description in "M 21" file).
marks: On inside of roller: (Tenna 2nd[?] Year (1683) Ear
medium: ink, color, and gold on silk
title: Tōkaidō Picture Scroll
